title: Provides for cost of living and marriage penalty adjustments to eligibility standards for the program for elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage
summary: Provides for cost-of-living and marriage penalty adjustments to eligibility standards for the program for elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage.

                                 I N  A S S E M B L Y

                                   February 1, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  M.  of  A.  ENGLEBRIGHT -- read once and referred to the
         Committee on Health

       AN ACT to amend the elder  law,  in  relation  to  cost  of  living  and
         marriage  penalty adjustments to eligibility standards for the program
         for elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section 1. Section 254 of the elder law is amended to read as follows:
    2    S  254.  ADJUSTMENTS.  1.  Cost  of living adjustment. [1.] (A) Within
    3  amounts appropriated, the panel shall  adjust  the  program  eligibility
    4  standards  set forth in subdivision two of section two hundred forty-two
    5  of this title to account for increases in the cost of living.
    6    [2.] (B) The panel shall further adjust individual  and  joint  income
    7  categories set forth in subdivisions two and four of section two hundred
    8  forty-eight of this title to conform to the adjustments made pursuant to
    9  THIS subdivision [one of this section].
   10    2.  MARRIAGE  PENALTY  ADJUSTMENT.    THE  PANEL  SHALL FURTHER ADJUST
   11  INCOME, REGISTRATION FEES, DEDUCTIBLES, AND OTHER PROGRAM COMPONENTS  TO
   12  ELIMINATE THE EPIC MARRIAGE PENALTY, AS FOLLOWS:
   13    (A)  FOR PURPOSES OF SUBDIVISIONS TWO AND FOUR OF SECTIONS TWO HUNDRED
   14  FORTY-SEVEN AND TWO HUNDRED FORTY-EIGHT  OF  THIS  TITLE,  JOINT  INCOME
   15  SHALL  BE  DEFINED  AS  INCOME,  AS  SUCH TERM IS DEFINED IN SECTION TWO
   16  HUNDRED FORTY-ONE OF THIS TITLE AND AS ADJUSTED PURSUANT TO  SUBDIVISION
   17  ONE OF THIS ACTION, DIVIDED BY TWO.
   18    (B) THE QUARTERLY REGISTRATION FEE ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO SECTION TWO
   19  HUNDRED  FORTY-SEVEN  OF  THIS  TITLE,  AND  THE LIMITS ON POINT OF SALE
   20  CO-PAYMENTS ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION FOUR OF SUCH SECTION, AS
   21  SUCH ITEMS MAY BE OR HAVE BEEN ADJUSTED BY THE PANEL PURSUANT TO  SUBDI-
   22  VISION  ONE OF THIS SECTION AND OTHER SECTIONS OF THIS CHAPTER, FOR EACH
   23  MARRIED INDIVIDUAL PROGRAM PARTICIPANT SHALL BE SET AT A LEVEL  THAT  IS
   24  NOT  GREATER  THAN THE QUARTERLY REGISTRATION FEE AND THE LIMIT ON POINT

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD04202-01-1

       A. 4136                             2

    1  OF SALE CO-PAYMENTS FOR UNMARRIED INDIVIDUAL PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS  WHOSE
    2  INCOME  EQUALS JOINT INCOME AS DEFINED IN PARAGRAPH (A) OF THIS SUBDIVI-
    3  SION.
    4    (C)  THE  ANNUAL  PERSONAL  COVERED DRUG EXPENDITURES FOR EACH MARRIED
    5  INDIVIDUAL ELIGIBLE PROGRAM PARTICIPANT ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO  SECTION
    6  TWO  HUNDRED FORTY-EIGHT OF THIS TITLE AS ADJUSTED BY THE PANEL PURSUANT
    7  TO SUBDIVISION ONE OF THIS SECTION AND OTHER SECTIONS OF  THIS  CHAPTER,
    8  SHALL  BE  SET  BY  THE  PANEL  AT  A LEVEL WHICH IS NO GREATER THAN THE
    9  PERSONAL COVERED DRUG EXPENDITURES  FOR  UNMARRIED  INDIVIDUAL  ELIGIBLE
   10  PROGRAM  PARTICIPANTS  WHOSE INCOME, AS ADJUSTED PURSUANT TO SUBDIVISION
   11  ONE OF THIS SECTION, EQUALS JOINT INCOME AS ADJUSTED PURSUANT  TO  PARA-
   12  GRAPH (A) OF THIS SUBDIVISION.
   13    (D)  THE  LIMITS  ON POINT OF SALE CO-PAYMENTS ESTABLISHED PURSUANT TO
   14  SUBDIVISION FOUR OF SECTIONS TWO HUNDRED  FORTY-SEVEN  AND  TWO  HUNDRED
   15  FORTY-EIGHT OF THIS TITLE, AS ADJUSTED BY THE PANEL PURSUANT TO SUBDIVI-
   16  SION  ONE  OF  THIS SECTION AND OTHER SECTIONS OF THIS CHAPTER, FOR EACH
   17  MARRIED INDIVIDUAL PROGRAM PARTICIPANT SHALL BE SET AT A LEVEL  THAT  IS
   18  NO  GREATER  THAN  THE  LIMIT ON POINT OF SALE CO-PAYMENTS FOR UNMARRIED
   19  INDIVIDUAL PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS WHOSE  INCOME  EQUALS  JOINT  INCOME  AS
   20  DEFINED IN PARAGRAPH (A) OF THIS SUBDIVISION.
   21    (E)  THE PANEL SHALL MAKE THE ADJUSTMENTS REQUIRED BY THIS SUBDIVISION
   22  ON A FOUR-YEAR SCHEDULE WHICH IT SHALL ADOPT AFTER CONSULTATION WITH THE
   23  DIVISION OF THE BUDGET BEGINNING WITH THE FISCAL  YEAR  NEXT  SUCCEEDING
   24  THE DATE ON WHICH THIS SUBDIVISION SHALL HAVE BECOME EFFECTIVE.
   25    S  2. This act shall take effect on the first of April next succeeding
   26  the date on which it shall have become a law.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the elder law, in relation to cost of living and marriage penalty adjustments to eligibility standards for the program for elderly pharmaceutical insurance coverage
